page.title: 15Trowell-Festival village
page.content: Trowell is an old settlement dating back to the 10th Century so that by 1066 it was a well developed parish.By the beginning of the 13th Century coal was being worked in Trowell Moor to be sent to Nottingham and stone was also extracted as building material,some of which was used in Nottingham Castle. Nottingham Canal was cut in the 18th Century.The railway was laid in 1845, the link to Radford which cuts across the bottom third of the D'Block was laid in 1878.The M1 motorway which bisects the village north to south was laid in 1966 and contains the Granada Service Station.In 1951 Trowell was Britains Festival Village,chosen as a typical English rural community. Trowell is essentially a rural area,most of the land being devoted to agriculture.The focal point of the village is where 3 main roads join.
